intro: Pterocephalus papposus, commonly known as the silky flax or Chinese flax, is a flowering plant native to China. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant produces fluffy, white seeds that are often used in traditional Chinese medicine. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in open, sunny areas. Its fibrous stalks and seeds have been utilized for various medicinal and industrial purposes throughout history.
